channel.title: Film and Television on output error
channel.description: Recent content in Film and Television on output error

item.title: Masculinity in Shane and Yojimbo
item.description: I’ve been going through some of my notes from a film genre class I took in graduate school. One week, we watched Shane and Yojimbo as cross-cultural examples of the western, which historically commingled with the samurai film in Japan.

item.title: Two Films on Catastrophe
item.description: Last night I watched Nicholas Ashe Bateman’s The Wanting Mare and Adam McKay’s Don’t Look Up. Each suggests a similar conclusion-in a senseless world, codependence is the only way to find meaning.

item.title: Satoyama, Modernity, and Tradition in Japanese Anime
item.description: I’ve been reading scholarship about anime, its history, and how it deviates from animation in the United States. It’s frequently observed that tensions between tradition and modernity are often central to anime.
